description: Advanced features unique to the World's Most Advanced Open Source Relational Database.

slides.title: Welcome to Postgres üêò
slides.content:
# Not just SQL

PostgreSQL is an object-relational database (ORDBMS).

Known for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

It supports advanced data types like Arrays, JSONB, and Geometric types.

slides.title: JSONB
slides.content:
# NoSQL in SQL üç¨

Store JSON documents efficiently with binary storage and indexing.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
SELECT info->>'name' 
FROM orders 
WHERE info @> '{"completed": true}';
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Array Types
slides.content:
# Lists in Cells üìã

Store arrays directly in a column.

`integer[]` or `text[]`.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
INSERT INTO contacts (emails)
VALUES ('{"me@test.com", "work@test.com"}');
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Window Functions
slides.content:
# Row Comparisons ü™ü

Perform calculations across a set of table rows that are somehow related to the current row.

`RANK()`, `ROW_NUMBER()`, `LEAD()`, `LAG()`.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
SELECT name, salary, 
RANK() OVER (ORDER BY salary DESC)
FROM employees;
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Full Text Search
slides.content:
# Built-in Search üîç

No need for Elasticsearch for basic needs.

Use `tsvector` and `tsquery`.

`SELECT * FROM docs WHERE body_tsvector @@ to_tsquery('postgres');`

slides.title: JSON Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which PostgreSQL data type is recommended for storing JSON because it supports indexing and is strictly validated?

slides.title: Extensions
slides.content:
# Power Up üîã

add functionality to Postgres.

- `PostGIS`: Geospatial data.
- `pg_trgm`: Fuzzy string matching.
- `citext`: Case-insensitive text.

`CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";`

slides.title: Inheritance
slides.content:
# Object Oriented üß¨

Tables can inherit column from a parent table.

`CREATE TABLE capitals() INHERITS (cities);`

Searching 'cities' also finds 'capitals'.

slides.title: Range Types
slides.content:
# Intervals üìÖ

Store ranges of data natively.

- `int4range`
- `daterange`
- `tsrange` (timestamp range)

Easy to check if a value falls within a range or if ranges overlap.

slides.title: Lateral Joins
slides.content:
# Loop Joins ‚û∞

Allows subqueries in the FROM clause to reference columns provided by preceding items in the FROM clause.

Great for 'Top N per group' queries.

slides.title: MVCC
slides.content:
# Concurrency üöÖ

Multi-Version Concurrency Control.

Readers don't block writers, and writers don't block readers. Optimized for high concurrency.

slides.title: Feature Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which popular extension adds support for geographic objects to the PostgreSQL database?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Postgres üêò

Advanced Capabilities.

- **JSONB:** Binary JSON.
- **Window Functions:** `OVER` clause.
- **Extensions:** PostGIS.
- **Arrays:** Store lists.
